title: General Knowledge Quiz
description: Test your knowledge with these fun questions!

questions.text: What is the capital of France?
questions.explanation: Paris is the capital and most populous city of France.

questions.text: Which planet is known as the Red Planet?
questions.explanation: Mars is known as the Red Planet due to its reddish appearance caused by iron oxide on its surface.

questions.text: Who wrote the play 'Romeo and Juliet'?
questions.explanation: William Shakespeare wrote the famous tragedy 'Romeo and Juliet' in the early part of his career.

questions.text: What is the largest ocean on Earth?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest and deepest ocean on Earth, covering about 30% of the planet's surface.

questions.text: In which year did the Titanic sink?
questions.explanation: The RMS Titanic sank on April 15, 1912, after hitting an iceberg during its maiden voyage.

questions.text: What is the chemical symbol for gold?
questions.explanation: Au is the chemical symbol for gold, derived from the Latin word 'aurum'.

questions.text: Which country is famous for inventing pizza?
questions.explanation: Pizza originated in Italy, specifically in Naples, during the 18th or early 19th century.

questions.text: What is the fastest land animal?
questions.explanation: The cheetah is the fastest land animal, capable of reaching speeds up to 70 mph (112 km/h).
There are 7 continents: Asia, Africa, North America, South America, Antarctica, Europe, and Australia.
